just across the state line in

Just across the Yamuna River from Delhi, this is Uttar Pradesh's most modern city and a popular location for businesses looking to escape Delhi's congestion and steep rents.
NOIDA boasts of the best roads in NCR,with excellent street lighting and cat-eyes which ensures maximum visibility during nights.It makes the whole driving experience a pleasure.
Now with NOIDA Metro i.e. an extension to Delhi Metro, you can reach from Delhi to NOIDA in no time.
The easiest way to go to Noida by public transport is to take the

Blue Line, which has numerous stops around the city.  The other alternative is DTC (Delhi Transport Corporaion) buses.

The

toll bridge (Rs.22) connects Noida to Delhi and is a pleasure to drive.  Note that if you're driving a black-plated commercial vehicle — in particular, a rented car — you're not allowed to use the bridge unless you've
paid the Uttar Pradesh road tax of Rs.240/day (there are no facilities for paying it here).
Noida is spottily connected by buses and rickshaws

. The buses are chiefly from Delhi.
The best option for getting around by taxi is to book it online by online car rental companies sites where you have the luxury of choosing from a variety of options like - ZipMyTravel.com
. They provide the services to travel intra-city also for visiting Jaipur, Agra (Taj Mahal) and other places in and around noida.

A scenic relief from Delhi, Noida is low on traffic and pollution (by Indian standards) and is dotted with parks and statues, none of them particularly noteworthy though.The city has done very well to keep up the green cover and the plantation of trees is done from time to time.

Noida Film City - A hub for films and television in India - Founded by Sandeep Marwah of Marwah Studios

value: content=An art gallery, where you can see and buy art pieces by various new as well as established talented artists. Open to public, this gallery has interesting exhibitions every month. Art lovers would love to be there.

Noida is filled with malls and shopping centers.

Apart from that Noida is filled with old style Indian markets like Atta, Indira Market, Choura, Khoda, Chellara, Harola, Naya Bans etc.

The only centre in Noida with recognised courses and recognition by Noida Authority. Learn Indian classical, Western and Bollywood style dance; vocal and instrumental music. Drawing and painting. Expert faculty. P-19, Sector-12, Noida. +919310034746-7

Alcohol in Uttar Pradesh is somewhat pricier than in Delhi.  The main nightlife district is

value: , Mosaic Hotel, Sector 18.  Slick two-floor bar and nightclub that looks somewhat like an Arctic cavern, with billowing white shapes and blue lighting.  Kingfisher Rs.200.
content=offers quite good range of cocktails. On the food side , good lebanese options
content=arguably one of the best nightclubs in Delhi-NCR.
content=Oldest hotel of Noida. Possibly 3-star. Good fast food joint, pastry shop, bakery, Tea/Coffee Lounge, Bar.
content=Sector 18. Formerly the Shipra Hotel, but after a 2006 renovation is now a "business boutique" hotel with the appearance of a hip nightclub (indeed,

is in the basement) and the price of a big-city Indian business hotel. Rooms are modern and comfortable, service is friendly and efficient, but wireless Internet is expensive and patchy. From US$200 up.
content=Noida's first but no longer only branded hotel. Weekday rates from US$400 up.
